page.title: 19Kettlethorpe Parish Council
page.content: Kettlethorpe Parish Council covers the Kettlethorpe and Laughterton villages and usually has seven elected members. If there are not enough nominees when re-election is due after a three year term, anyone who has been proposed and accepted automatically serves on the Council. A clerk is employed to deal with all correspondance etc. Various planning and building applications are sent to the Council for their consideration and the chance to voice anxieties over any problems is given by the West Lindsey District Council. With limited funds allocated by West Lindsey District Council, the Parish Council looks after the needs of the local community. The villages are encouraged to enter the "Best Kept Village" competition and the annual inter- village Cricket and Rounders matches.
